cycle_count_example.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*This file has been prepared for Doxygen automatic documentation generation.*/
00103 #if __GNUC__
00104 #  include "intc.h"
00105 #endif
00106 
00107 #define _ASSERT_ENABLE_
00108 #include "compiler.h"
00109 #include "print_funcs.h"
00110 #include "board.h"
00111 #include "count.h"
00112 #include "pm.h"
00113 
00114 
00115 #define NB_CLOCK_CYCLE_DELAY_SHORT    1000000
00116 #define NB_CLOCK_CYCLE_DELAY_LONG    20000000
00117 
00118 
00119 static volatile unsigned int u32NbCompareIrqTrigger = 0;
00120 static volatile unsigned char u8DisplayMsg = 0;
00121 
00122 #if __GNUC__
00123 __attribute__((__interrupt__))
00124 #elif __ICCAVR32__
00125 #pragma handler = AVR32_CORE_IRQ_GROUP, 3
00126 __interrupt
00127 #endif
00128 static void compare_irq_handler(void)
00129 {
00130   // Count the number of times this IRQ handler is called.
00131   u32NbCompareIrqTrigger++;
00132   u8DisplayMsg = 1; // Inform the main program that it may display a msg saying
00133                     // that the COUNT&COMPARE interrupt occurred.
00134                     // Disable the compare and exception generation feature: set COMPARE to 0.
00135   Set_sys_compare(0);
00136 }
00137 
00138 /* Main function */
00139 int main(void)
00140 {
00141    U32 u32CompareVal;
00142    U32 u32ComparePreviousVal = 0;
00143    U32 u32CompareValVerif;
00144    U32 u32CountVal;
00145    U32 u32CountNextVal;
00146    U8  u8LedMap = 0x01;
00147    volatile avr32_pm_t* pm = &AVR32_PM;
00148 
00149    // Switch the main clock to OSC0
00150    pm_switch_to_osc0(pm, FOSC0, OSC0_STARTUP);
00151    // Init DEBUG module
00152    init_dbg_rs232(FOSC0);
00153 
00154    print_dbg("---------------------------------------------\n");
00155 
00156    // Read COMPARE register.
00157    // NOTE: it should be equal to 0 (default value upon reset) => The compare
00158    // and exception generation feature is thus currently disabled.
00159    u32CompareVal = Get_sys_compare();
00160    Assert(!u32CompareVal);
00161 
00162    // Read COUNT register.
00163    // NOTE: the COUNT register increments since reset => it should be != 0.
00164    u32CountVal = Get_sys_count();
00165    Assert(u32CountVal);
00166 
00167 #if __GNUC__
00168    // Disable all interrupts.
00169    Disable_global_interrupt();
00170 
00171    INTC_init_interrupts();
00172 
00173    // Register the compare interrupt handler to the interrupt controller.
00174    // compare_irq_handler is the interrupt handler to register.
00175    // AVR32_CORE_COMPARE_IRQ is the IRQ of the interrupt handler to register.
00176    // INT0 is the interrupt priority level to assign to the group of this IRQ.
00177    // void INTC_register_interrupt(__int_handler handler, unsigned int irq, unsigned int int_lev);
00178    INTC_register_interrupt(&compare_irq_handler, AVR32_CORE_COMPARE_IRQ, INT0);
00179 #endif
00180    // Enable all interrupts.
00181    Enable_global_interrupt();
00182 
00183    // Schedule the COUNT&COMPARE match interrupt in NB_CLOCK_CYCLE_DELAY_SHORT 
00184    // clock cycles from now.
00185    u32CountVal = Get_sys_count();
00186 
00187    u32CompareVal = u32CountVal + NB_CLOCK_CYCLE_DELAY_SHORT; // WARNING: MUST FIT IN 32bits.
00188    // If u32CompareVal ends up to be 0, make it 1 so that the COMPARE and exception
00189    // generation feature does not get disabled.
00190    if(0 == u32CompareVal)
00191    {
00192       u32CompareVal++;
00193    }
00194 
00195    Set_sys_compare(u32CompareVal); // GO
00196 
00197    // Check if the previous write in the COMPARE register succeeded.
00198    u32CompareValVerif = Get_sys_compare();
00199    Assert( u32CompareVal==u32CompareValVerif );
00200 
00201    //  The previous COMPARE write succeeded.
00202    // Loop until the COUNT&COMPARE match triggers.
00203    while (!u32NbCompareIrqTrigger)
00204    {
00205       u32CountNextVal = Get_sys_count();
00206 
00207       if (u32CountNextVal < u32CompareVal)
00208          print_dbg("COUNT HAS NOT REACHED COMPARE YET (INFO)\n");
00209       else if (u32CountNextVal > u32CompareVal)
00210          print_dbg("COUNT IS GREATER THAN COMPARE (INFO)\n");
00211       else
00212          print_dbg("COUNT IS EQUAL TO COMPARE (INFO)\n");
00213    }
00214 
00215    while (TRUE)
00216    {
00217       if (u8DisplayMsg)
00218       {
00219          u8DisplayMsg = 0; // Reset
00220 
00221          // Turn the current LED on only and move to next LED.
00222          LED_Display_Field(LED_MONO0_GREEN |
00223                            LED_MONO1_GREEN |
00224                            LED_MONO2_GREEN |
00225                            LED_MONO3_GREEN,
00226                            u8LedMap);
00227          u8LedMap = max((U8)(u8LedMap << 1) & 0x0F, 0x01);
00228 
00229          // Print some info on the debug port.
00230          print_dbg("\nCOMPARE INTERRUPT TRIGGERED (OK): #");
00231          print_dbg_ulong(u32NbCompareIrqTrigger);
00232 
00233          // Schedule the COUNT&COMPARE match interrupt in NB_CLOCK_CYCLE_DELAY_LONG
00234          // clock cycles from now.
00235          u32CountVal = Get_sys_count();
00236 
00237          u32CompareVal = u32CountVal + NB_CLOCK_CYCLE_DELAY_LONG;
00238          // If u32CompareVal ends up to be 0, make it 1 so that the COMPARE and
00239          // exception generation feature does not get disabled.
00240          if(0 == u32CompareVal)
00241          {
00242             u32CompareVal++;
00243          }
00244 
00245          Set_sys_compare(u32CompareVal); // GO
00246 
00247          print_dbg("\n\tLatest COUNT == ");
00248          print_dbg_hex(u32CountVal);
00249          print_dbg(", COMPARE == ");
00250          print_dbg_hex(u32CompareVal);
00251 
00252          // What happens when COUNT reaches the 32-bit limit:
00253          // registers nicely loop around 0.
00254          if (u32CompareVal < u32ComparePreviousVal)
00255          {
00256             print_dbg("\nHere we are! Breaking the 32-bit limit!\n");
00257          }
00258          u32ComparePreviousVal = u32CompareVal;
00259       }
00260    }
00261 }
